bNode:x467ce421-1a30-4a2f-9208-0a4b01cd0.a:contents: [Rx4RDF] is a specification and reference implementation for querying, transforming and updating W3C's [RDF]. By specifying a deterministic mapping of the RDF model to an abstract XML DOM familiar XML technologies can be used to manipulate RDF, in particular XPath, XSLT and XUpdate. We call their RDF equivalents [RxPath], [RxSLT], and [RxUpdate] respectively. You can also find here [RxML], alternative XML serialization for RDF that is designed for easy and simple authoring, particularly in conjunction with [Rxity]
bNode:x467ce421-1a30-4a2f-9208-0a4b01cd0.P:
You can also find here some applications demonstrating the power of this technology, including:
Racoon, a simple application server that uses an RDF model for its data store, roughly analogous to RDF as Apache Cocoon is to XML.
Running on Racoon is need a name, a simple wiki-like web application that can display and edit any arbitrary RDF model using RxSLT and RxUpdate.
Another application of Racoon is Rxiki, a full-fledged content management and delivery system. It is dynamic and self-editable like a Wiki but uses Rxity to enable structured content and editable metadata and Racoon to provide rules for personalization, full control over presentation, workflow, etc. This is site is run on Rxiki.
Rx4RDF is an adhoc, open source project. Your feedback and participation is strongly encouraged. It is hosted by Source Forge -- mailing lists, etc. can be found there.
